quizName: Part 3: Tips on conducting a class

answers.text: Does less talking that the students.
Does more talking than the students.
Caters to every student in the class.
Makes use of interactive teaching strategies.

questions.question_text: Which of the following counters the teacher's role as facilitator of learning?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: By providing all the answers to your students.
By placing time markers in your lesson plan.
By skipping questions that you have no time to complete.
By going faster.

questions.question_text: How do you ensure that you do not overrun your lesson?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: When students are controlled by the teacher.
When students are engaged in activities that lead them to realise their set goal.
When students pursue their task without inhibition.

answers.html: When students blindly obey teacher's instructions.<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>
answers.text: When students blindly obey teacher's instructions.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes a well managed class?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Neat appearance.
Positive interaction with students.
Punctuality.
Impartiality.

questions.question_text: What entails professionalism in teaching?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Maintaining eye contact only with the student you are conversing with.

answers.html: Getting another student to echo a student's question.<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>
answers.text: Getting another student to echo a student's question.

answers.html: Answering a student's question right away without first echoing the question to the class.<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>
answers.text: Answering a student's question right away without first echoing the question to the class.
Not looking at the students when taking attendance.
Not getting the students to echo your question.

questions.question_text: What are the common mistakes discussed in Part 3 video on eye contact and echoing?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: At the front of the class.
At the corner of the class.
No fixed position; move around in the class.
At the back of the class.

questions.question_text: Where should a teacher position himself/herself in the classroom?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: To find out the location of the room.
All of the above.
To test out the equipment such as the projector.
To check out the whiteboard markers.
To check out the furniture arrangement.

questions.question_text: Why do you need to check out the tutorial room before your first lesson?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Speaking too softly.
Overly strict.
Poor time management.
Lack of energy level.
Lack of interaction.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are listed in the greenhorns' mistakes (from audit) in Part 3 video? <script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Cooperative learning.
Criticism.
Competition.
Long assignments.

questions.question_text: Which of the following marks a conducive learning environment?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Speak with more confidence.
Tell too many stories.
Too much control.
No eye contact.
Be more prepared.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are listed in the greenhorns' mistakes (from students' feedback) in Part 3 video? <script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

quizInfo.title: Part 3: Tips on conducting a class
quizInfo.description:
This quiz is based on the video "How to Teach, Part 3". 

There are 6 multiple-choice questions (MCQs) and 4 multiple-response questions (MRQs).

Each MCQ has one correct answer. Each question is worth one mark.

Each MRQ has one or more correct answers. You need to pick all the correct answers to get 1 mark per question.

To pass this quiz, you need to get at least 5 marks out of 10.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are some of Bloom's six categories of questions?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Transfer
Application
Knowledge
Analysis
Evaluation

questions.question_text: What should a teacher consider when planning her questions?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.html: Formulate different types of questions (short, direct, open-ended, etc.)<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>
answers.text: Formulate different types ofquestions (short, direct, open-ended, etc.)
Set aside enough time in class for question asking.
Allow students time to formulate their replies.
Be prepared to handle awkward moments.

questions.question_text: In Part 2 video, what are the ways a teacher may handle a student's question which the teacher has no answer to?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Direct the question to the class.
Get back to the student later with the answer.
Show the class how to find the answer.
Ask student to find out the answer himself.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are possible means to help teachers explain a concept?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Using walk-through.
Using examples.
Using analogy.
Using diagrams.

questions.question_text: While listening to your student, what should you do?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Be non-judgemental and do not criticise.
Get the speaker to also write down his points.

answers.html: Tune in to the speaker's nonverbal behavior and emotions.<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>
answers.text: Tune in to the speaker's nonverbal behavior and emotions.
Interrupt the speaker frequently to ask questions.

questions.question_text: What are the purposes for teachers to ask questions?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: As a form of feedback.
As a form of class management.
As a form of encouragement.
As a form of assessment.
As a form of interaction.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are the key teaching activities mentioned in Part 2 video?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Explaining.
Building rapport.
Monitoriing.
Giving and receiving feedback.
Setting challenging tasks.

questions.question_text: In Part 2 video, which activity is cited as an example to bring out the teacher's enthusiasm, motivation and rapport building?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: Asking questions.
Memorisiing students' names.
Conducting help sessions.
Setting challenging exam.

questions.question_text: What are the objectives of the pre-workshop group activity mentioned in Part 2 video?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: It demonstrates elements of teaching through presentations.
It hypes up the participants.
It provides healthy competition among the participants.
It serves as an ice breaker.
It facilitates the sharing of information.

questions.question_text: What is "withitness" mentioned in Part 2 video?<script src="https://instructure-uploads-apse1.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/account_214500000000000001/attachments/18442/BlueCanvasMobileConfig.js"></script>

answers.text: It means that the teacher is aware of every action in the classroom and will respond accordingly.
It means that the teacher has good time management.
It means that the teacher is always with the students and support them.
It means that the teacher has a good grasp on the course materials and administration of the course.

quizInfo.description:
This quiz is based on the video "How to Teach, Part 2". 

There are 2 multiple-choice questions (MCQs) and 8 multiple-response questions (MRQs).

Each MCQ has one correct answer. Each question is worth one mark.

Each MRQ has one or more correct answers. You need to pick all the correct answers to get 1 mark per question.

To pass this quiz, you need to get at least 5 marks out of 10.
quizInfo.title: Part 2: Interaction in class
